title: The application of precision agricultural techniques to archaeological survey

tasks.task: Conducting archaeological survey using NDVI and precision agriculture methods
subtasks: Locating the route of the Roman road in Alaba
Reviewing historical and archaeological sources for previous studies
Verifying historical maps and plans related to the Roman road
Performing an exhaustive toponymic study of place names mentioned in medieval road resources
Analyzing vertical aerial photographs from 1972 to present
Utilizing drone-mounted infrared cameras for NDVI imaging
Processing NDVI images to identify agricultural patterns indicative of Roman road features
Comparing NDVI results with historic archaeological data
Confirming the validity of the NDVI method through controlled test sites
Identifying and mapping the publication of two potential structural remains from archaeological surveys
